title.text: I The International jlournal of Supercomputer Applications

abstractContent.text: Supercomputer Applications is devoted to a collection of articles that demonstrates the benefits of using visualization as an essential approach for interpreting and evaluating computational results.
Guest edited by Steve Follin, this exciting issue is accompanied by an hour-long videotape available in VHS format, with segments elucidating each of the featured articles.

Vol. 4, No. 2 covers problems ranging from the simulation of global climatic effects of greenhouse gases and the evolution of a numerically severe storm to the photomet-ric classification of clouds on Jupiter and the numerical simulation of flow through an artificial heart valve.
Order today and see for yourself how visualization is enabling researchers to represent the scientific challenges that supercomputers are addressing.
